name: White Oak Manor Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: White Oak B&B was a delight. The rooms were spacious with nice big windows and sitting areas. The inn had a great porch for sitting and drinking morning coffee and evening wine. It had scrumptious creative breakfast and the owners accommodated vegetarian and Gluten free diets without complaint or comment perfectly. The owners had carefully thought through what their guest would like in unexpected amenities including Keurig coffee makers with numerous coffee choices in each room, mini fridges in each room, make-up removal wipes and on and on. In addition there was a microwave with popcorn and a fridge with soft drinks and water on the guest floor. The owners were very personable but not intrusive. The inn is a few blocks from the main area of town which was nice from a noise standpoint and parking in Jefferson is no problem. All in all just a great B&B experience. Thanks Tammy and David for a delightful time.
reviews.title: Best B&B we have stayed in

reviews.text: Tammy and Dave were the perfect hostess. My fiancée and I came upon their utterly beautiful and historic B&B out of sheer coincidence. We were staying in Jefferson, TX as a central location for us to conduct our house search due to a company relocation; and not having the slightest of what this quaint colonel white B&B was going to bring us. In the end, the stresses’ of house hunting melted away and were completely alleviated by the warm smiles, magnificent food, and great conversation. Tammy and Dave, we will cherish that stay for a long time to come.
reviews.title: Perfect even for the business travelers!

reviews.text: Thanks again,
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P&A
reviews.title: Thank you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and Dave....
reviews.title: Great Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very lovely house, well maintained and a pleasure to stay in. My boyfriend and I took a mini getaway to Jefferson. This is the first B&B either one of us had ever stayed in. At first I was a little nervous, seems like you are staying in someone else house but that is not the case at all, the nervousness quickly passed and the enchantment began. Tammy and Dave are wonderful hosts and a super nice couple. They make you feel right at home and Dave's mean cooking skills in the kitchen are a must try! The rooms are clean, beautiful and have everything you could think of needing. We stayed in the Southern Charm Room and I was sad to leave it! We will defiantly be back and will recommend it to anyone who will listen. Thank you Tammy and Dave, it was an excellent weekend!
reviews.title: Magnificent Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the White Oak Manor to celebrate our anniversary. The atmosphere, cleanliness, and owners exceeded every expectation we had. The attention to detail is obvious as soon as you walk through the door. You can tell immediately that every need or desire has been thought out throughly. Besides having easy access to wifi, there are cold drinks, popcorn, sweet delicious treats, and coffee available for every guest. Many bed and breakfasts have great amenities, but the owners truly make this place beyond exceptional. Tammy was more than happy to take pictures of my husband and I out front and the breakfast her and Dave cooked was 5 star quality. They made us feel like family. We will definitely come back!
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful

reviews.text: My friend, Janet Lohr, and I had such a wonderful and relaxing time at White Oak Manor. It is absolutely gorgeous, inviting, and so perfectly clean. ( I am super big on clean!) I had told the owners Dave and Tammy a few months earlier that I would not be eating breakfast... but once I caught the aroma... I went every morning! Each day our breakfast was a dream! We enjoyed the Quilt Show because even horrid weather did not stop the 2 of us. We always went back around 7:00 p.m. We had eaten by then and could enjoy talking and showing off our purchases. We slept well and watched the MANOR DVD'S. We loved the history of the owners more than any other history we stumbled across. We are planning to go back next Quilt Show! If I ever run away... I know where I am going to go to be pampered!
reviews.title: So Peaceful ! Becca H.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were welcomed so graciously by Tammy and her daughter. Our room was thoughtfully appointed with everything we might need. Tammy was most helpful in suggesting properties with full kitchens for a future stay. We particually enjoyed the fantastic breakfast she served us, and left feeling relaxed and revitalized. Thanks so much White Oak Manor. We'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: Serenity and Comfort in Jefferson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I "ranaway" for the Thanksgiving holiday to the White Oak Manor B&B. We had an wonderful, relaxing time. Dave and Tammy were gracious hosts and very accomodting. They handled our gluten/pork free diet requirements with ease and made a special trip to find gluten free Bisquick! That really impressed us as going above and beyond the call of duty!!! Thanks again to Dave and Tammy! We will definitley return!
reviews.title: Thanksgiving getaway

reviews.text: Thanks to the B&B for Vets Program and the generosity of Dave and Tammy, my wife and I and two of our retired military friends got to visit a beautiful part of Texas we had never been to - but plan to go back to.
reviews.title: Veteran's Day Treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dave and Tammy have thought of everything at the White Oak Manor - three beautifully furnished and appointed rooms with every detail taken care of. We have stayed at several B&Bs over the years and this one rates with the best.
reviews.title: Wonderful Anniversary Get-Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the day Tammy enthusiastically took our reservations, to their warm greeting when we arrived, to the delicious breakfast they served us before we left - we felt like family and were made to feel at home.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is beautiful in spite of the storm that hit while we were there. Our purpose for wanting to visit the area was to enjoy a couple of the local wineries - but any excuse to visit is a good one.
reviews.title: Wonderful Birthday Weekend

reviews.text: Thank you Dave and Tammy !
reviews.title: Great place for a girls weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to leave a day early on a trip to visit my sisters in Arkansas and investigate the small town of Jefferson, Texas along the way. We had always heard that there were lots of B&Bs there, so I looked on the internet and found White Oak Manor. It was a lovely old home with the very nicest of inn keepers! Tammy was very friendly and helpful to direct us around town and Dave served the most exceptional of breakfasts! They were both warm and friendly and enjoyable to visit with. Their home is beautiful and comfortable and very clean. We would recommend this B&B to anyone.
reviews.title: A Lovely Place to Stay
Great First Experience!
reviews.text: This was our first experience staying in a bed and breakfast, and it was such a nice one. A comfortable room with all the amenities you could wish for, a fantastic breakfast, and friendly hosts. The town of Jefferson is a fun place to explore, too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved our stay with Tammy and Dave at White Oak Manor. Homey, clean, comfortable, not a gooped-up, overdone Victorian with junk on every surface. I am allergic to fragrances, and this was the one place out of seven where we stayed that I could actually breathe -- even though others said their rooms were fragrance-free. Room clean, lovely, comfortable. Street and "Old Town" quite charming. We took a long lazy walk around the town and loved it.
reviews.title: Homey. Clean. Comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the White Oak Manor during the Outlaws Antique Car Show and highly enjoyed our stay. The breakfast each morning was beyond AMAZING. The town of Jefferson is lovely with lots to do.
reviews.title: Wonderful Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time staying at a B&B and we LOVED it. The owners were extemely curteous and very helpful with everything.
reviews.title: Peaceful

description: Our bed and breakfast will easily become your lodging choice while visiting the area. The White Oak Manor was built in the early 1900's with changes made along the way. We are conveniently located a few blocks from the downtown area for easy walking to all the antique shops and restaurants. Jefferson Texas is known for it's historic homes and buildings, ghost walk tours, riverboat tours, Steam engine train rides and even romantic carriage rides.Breakfast at the White Oak Manor is served every morning using fresh ingredients, family recipes and a friendly atmosphere.Each room is uniquely decorated and a comfortable space so you'll feel right at home here. Today we offer 37" flat screen TVs, Wireless internet, bathrobes, king or queen bed rooms, coffee/tea service in each room and private bathrooms.
